department: College of Computing and Digital Media
biography: Rhoel Lomahan currently works as a Technical Architect for AT&T. He leads a global team that handles online projects for att.com. Rhoel also provides technical solutions using a number of technologies such as J2EE, API development and Web Services. Rhoel has worked in various capacities involving almost every aspect of web development from technical requirements, collection/analysis, estimating, project planning and management, design, development, usability testing, performance tuning and system capacity planning, load building, integration and system testing, staging and implementation, deployment, training, to maintenance. He is also a certified resilient engineer within AT&T.<br><br>Prior to joining AT&T, he worked for USFreightways Corp as a ASP and Cold Fusion developer. In addition, he has worked for number of media companies such as Augsburg Fortress Publisher and DDB Worldwide<br><br>Rhoel received his B.S. in Communication Design from University of Illinois at Chicago and a Master Degree in E-Commerce Technology from DePaul University.<br>
